Description: Rim and body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup; interior glazed black; exterior: lip glazed; below in reserved handle zone, black-figure decoration consisting of dancing youths (only lower body of youth on left missing, facing right, head turned, and gesticulating; traces of added white on jerkin; at right, head and arms of second youth, facing right.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 399, no. B589)
CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 42, pl. XXI, no. 18)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1366) (phase 3)
